Posts.Content: Jasminn wrote: Hi everyone.  I was just diagnosed last Friday with extensive LCIS and an area of ILC.  My MRI report isn't in yet, but I just met with my surgeon, and he talked about doing a lumpectomy...from the ultrasound and mammo reports, it seems as if my tumor is Stage I.  He doubts there is any lymph node imvolvement yet, but without results, I'm still skeptical.  Anyway, I have 99% decided to do a bilat mast, probably no recon.  I'm 43 and happily married, and my husband fully supports this decision.   My surgeon also supports the decision 100% even though he initially suggested a lumpectomy.  Is this too radical?  Am I crazy?  I know from reading these boards that many of you have also gone that route, and I was wondering if you're happy with the decision.  For those who didn't have recon - do you miss your boobies?  Dx 11/14/2008, ILC, <1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 2, 1/9 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 1/9/2009 Lymph node removal: Left, Right; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 5/13/2009 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Surgery 8/18/2009 Prophylactic ovary removal Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Please tell me I'm not crazy Jasminn bettysgirl

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2008 03:35AM Jasminn wrote: Thanks everyone for your responses.  It's such a difficult decision...and a scary one, and not something I thought I'd have to think about at this stage of my life.  I'm so thankful to everyone on these boards and for all the support I've gotten in such a short time.  My surgeon said he'll put both options on the record and schedule surgery for the week after Thanksgiving.  That will give me maybe another week to decide.
Posts.Title: Please tell me I'm not crazy Jasminn bettysgirl

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2008 04:37AM - edited Nov 22, 2008 09:05AM by Jasminn Cathi- I'm so glad to hear you're doing great and you feel that you have won the battle!  I can't wait until I am at that stage in this thing.  Right now, I'm just terribly scared of the chance it has metastasized.  I've become a hypochondriac - ths smallest pain or discomfort, and I think it has spread.  Can't wait to have the PET scan and hopefully put that fear to rest.  Your post is very encouraging to me.  I'm 99.9% sure I don't want recon.  I think I'll adjust to being flat better than I'd adjust to more surgeries, more potential issues, etc.  I'm only a B cup, so I practically look flat with a sports bra on anyway! Good luck with the rest of your recovery!  It's wonderful that you're happy with your decision!

Wendy - Bloomer?  Is that up by Eau Claire?  I'm a fellow Wisconsinite - from West Allis (milwaukee).  Glad to hear you're 4 years out - very encouraging to us newbies!
